page.title: 04Introducing the Peak Park
page.content: The functions room doubles as a family room at weekends as children are not normally allowed in the bar areas. The Maynard Arms is an hotel with conference/ballroom facilities, boasting a lovely view from the dining room of the nightly floodlit gardens. Mobile refreshments vans litter the roadside in summer offering ice-creams teas and snacks. From the old Toll House an acute bend leads back to Ringinglow offering lorry and bus free motoring, spectacular views over Bamford and beyond, but also hazardous conditions on an icy winters day. As the motorist passes through this area, he may not only appreciate the creators of the millstones, hewn from the moorland boulders but also the conservation work of National Parks and Country Parks, free for all to enjoy.
